name: Constrained Dark Matter Identification
description: Identifies dark matter candidates with tau > 10^10 years using TSI and additional geometric symmetry constraints.

hypothesis.H0: High TSI unassigned topologies show no significant overlap with the required physical properties of dark matter candidates.
hypothesis.H1: Dark matter candidates correspond to a small subset (< 10) of high TSI topologies (TSI > 100) that also satisfy specific topological symmetry requirements.

data_requirements.description: Full knot dataset (Crossing 3-12) with TSI and symmetry invariants (e.g., Homfly symmetry).

physical_constraints.notes: Must use existing TSI model and theoretical symmetry constraints to reduce FPR.

test_method: Candidate enrichment analysis compared to random null distribution.
